item.title: Debunking the 'Kid Cost' Myth: Why Children Are Cheaper Than You Think
item.description: The terrifying cost of raising children is largely a myth. Learn how global data reveals the truth about manageable family expenses.

item.title: The Real Cost of Raising a Child from Birth to 18
item.description:
Every parent knows that raising a child is expensive, but the actual numbers might surprise you. For data-driven parents, understanding where the money goes is the first step toward smart financial planning.

The Bottom Line: $300,000+

For a middle-income family, the total cost of raising a child to age 18 typically falls between $280,000 and $318,949. This translates to over $1,800 per monthâ€”a significant line item in any family’s budget.
